intro: Louiseania ulmifolia, commonly known as the elm-leaved louiseania, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves that resemble those of elm trees, hence its common name. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red, blooming in the spring. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
